title: Senior Storage Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the recruiter following a review of the job description that was emailed.  Next, a 30 minute phone call with the recruiter describing the role, the company, people, environment based on job responsibility that the manager passed along.  My experience with government opportunities have been similar to this respect. Very limited interview process following the vetting. Three offers at the time were on the table for me.  After a review of all three, University of Texas System had the best overall career-wise track for me.  I accepted the opportunity the following day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current job ( position )?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at hirealonghorn job site and then I received an availability schedule to fill out and return via email or in person and within a few days I was called in for a group interview/briefing that lasted about 40min
Interview Questions: very easy, the "interview" was more of a casual talk and briefing on how the job was going to be

title: Senior Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then panel interview in person.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected questions.

title: Assistant Professor, Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: They were two interviews one phone call and face -to face
Interview Questions: Business case

title: Research Analyst In Strategic Initiatives Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas System
Interview Descriptions: Interview was approximately 1 hour with a panel of 3 people--the assistant director of the dept and 2 potential colleagues. Questions were pretty standard and dealt with specific job experience and technical skills. After the interview there is a 45 minute assessment (pen and paper) that requires you to write syntax for data management and analysis using SAS.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had a conflict and how you resolved it

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Submit the transcript and resume before the deadline. Specified what you are interesting in, and reveal your personality in the personal statement.
Interview Questions: Put enough effort on the personal statement.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: First round was a phone interview, then brought in for an in-person. It was pretty straightforward. I did not have prior experience in this field. I met with a future coworker, immediate supervisor, and department head in the final interview. It took about 2 months to hear back about my application, and the rest of the process was over in 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Last question: what would you be doing if you weren't in this field?

title: PeopleSoft Access Control Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Fort Worth, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first on the phone and then in person. The phone interview was very basic but when I interviewed 1 on 1 the questions were a good bit more difficult. I didnt feel like I did all that well in the interview
Interview Questions: They asked me about integration broker and I was not at the time very fluid with it

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application, was invited to come in for a skills test before being considered.  Then I was called to come in for an interview with two interviewers.  I did well, however didn't have the experience they were looking for.  The individuals I met were pleasant and engaging.  I will look forward to another opportunity - seemed like a place I'd like to work for.
Interview Questions: What makes you a better candidate than someone with more experience in accounting?

title: Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening then on campus visit. met 13 people including dean.
Interview Questions: What do you plan to do to contribute to this dept. your first year.

title: Instructional Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: very light interview no hard questions just discussed my experience
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Richardson, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for the position of math tutor first, and then the process is we are asked to give couple or may be 3 subject math tests, whose difficulty levels were really high, and only people with strong hold on math could make it through. the grading system was very fair. I performed really nice on the test and my employer was very much impressed with my performance and thus I had the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 visits with 2 rounds of interviews. Wonderful people,staff, and environment.
Interview Questions: None were difficult

title: Library Web and Technology Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Richardson, TX) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through our University career page for part time jobs. The position required basic web skills along with some computer hardware knowledge and as I already had a personal page, the employer saw it and gave me a call for an interview. During the day of the interview, there was a panel of three people who interviewed me. They all were very nice and made me feel very relaxed. The following questions were asked:
1)  One interviewer showed me a printout of a HTML page which had a small list of items and asked me which tags were used to create this list.
2) Other interviewer had opened a CPU box and asked all the components inside it.
Interview Questions: which HTML tag is used to create an unordered list??

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Richardson, TX) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a pleasant experience, first met w/ administrator who was leaving, then with the professor who I would be working for.  Administrator explained the requirements of the job, spoke w/ her for around 1/2 hours. then met one on one with the professor. he was a personable, relaxed fellow i would have enjoyed working for. i was hopeful that i was going to get an offer and was very disappointed when i didn't. when i called to follow up in a weeks time i got the impression i might have been the #2 pick, as the admin indicated that they were making someone else the offer, but they didn't know yet whether they were accepting
Interview Questions: Do you think you will be bored w/ this job

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Richardson, TX) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Met with secretarial staff/directors and assistant vice president.
The questions were silly and the atmosphere was negative. 
There appeared to be no diversity in those who were interviewing me.

A question asked, "What type of ceral I would be if I could be one?'" is irrelavant."
Interview Questions: What type of ceral would you be if you could be one?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Houston, TX) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
For this particular interview, the professor contacted me through email. On the interview day, there were 2 professors interviewed me.  During the interview, they explained the project to me very clearly and brought me to the laboratory. After that, they started to ask me tons of questions. From what i remembered, the below are the questions that they asked. 

1. Tell me more about yourself?
2. Why should we hire you?
3. What is your major strength and weakness?
4. what was your thesis project? Please explain the details
5. What were the skills that you learn during your graduate study
Interview Questions: What is your strength?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: They try to find out if you are capable of completing tasks as a RA.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in Data processing, Stata, SQL

title: Systems Administrator  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Austin, TX) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
called, offered/scheduled interview
first interview with group
wait 1 week
email/schedule 2nd round
second group interview
wait 1 week
not hired email
Interview Questions: why should we hire you over any of the other candidates?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was an international student. I had a master of science in electrical engineering prior to joining UT Dallas. Basically, I sent my resume to the graduate office and after processing my application, they contacted me. I also contacted a professor in EE department to financially support me and he offer an assistantship.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult question. Your resume will speak

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Richardson, TX) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: ask some behavior questions
Interview Questions: what are you going to do after graduation?

title: Chem Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Odessa, TX) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was very simple, I had already completed one and a half years of undergraduate research with my boss and upon graduating with my degree he asked me to work for him full-time on his grant.
Interview Questions: What do you think we could do to improve the process for the uses of biomass as a fuel?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas System (Memphis, TN) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Long delay between applying for job online and being contacted for interview.  Interview only consisted of meeting immediate supervisor.  Offer made my HR rep.  Salary was extremely low compared to other offers for similar positions in the same area.  HR was adamant that their offer was competitive but it was $12,000 less than my other offers.
Interview Questions: No unusual or difficult questions
